org.sbrubbles.conditio

Class Signals

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbrubbles.conditio.Signals

  • public final class Signals
extends Object
    Utilities for signals.

    This class acts as a namespace, and isn't meant to be inherited or instantiated.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <C extends Condition>
      Predicate<Signal<C>>      		 conditionType(Class<C> type)
      Creates a predicate which checks if a signal holds a condition compatible with the given type.
      static <C extends Condition>
      Predicate<Signal<C>>      		 returnType(Class<?> type)
      Creates a predicate which checks if a signal expects a result compatible with the given type.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • conditionType

        public static <C extends Condition> Predicate<Signal<C>> conditionType(Class<C> type)
        Creates a predicate which checks if a signal holds a condition compatible with the given type.
        Type Parameters:
        C - the expected type for the condition.
        Parameters:
        type - the expected type, in Class form, for the condition. May not be null.
        Returns:
        a predicate which checks if a signal has a condition compatible with the given type.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given type is null.

      • returnType

        public static <C extends Condition> Predicate<Signal<C>> returnType(Class<?> type)
        Creates a predicate which checks if a signal expects a result compatible with the given type.
        Parameters:
        type - the expected type for the result. May not be null.
        Returns:
        a predicate which checks if a signal expects a result compatible with the given type.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the given type is null.
